Comment: > MSNBC host Lawrence O’Donnell claims an answer that President Trump gave in an interview could be a sign of “mental illness.” O’Donnell speculated about what could be gleaned about Trump’s mind when, asked on Meet the Press if he thinks he needs to uphold the Constitution as president, he answered: “I don’t know.” “Donald Trump’s answer was: ‘I don’t know,’ which could be a sign of mental illness, or it could be a sign of early-stage dementia in a 78-year-old man,” O’Donnell claimed on The Last Word Wednesday night. “Or it could simply be the product of a condition that Donald Trump has been exhibiting throughout his public life since long before he got into politics, and that is, of course, Donald Trump’s trademark public stupidity,” O’Donnell said.   I'd say it's both.

Comment: It’s just my opinion but I think he’s saying that to look for the loophole. He can say yes, absolutely, or no, can disregard, he doesn’t want to say no exactly even if that’s what he’s doing. Or maybe, but maybe means no he doesn’t think he has to all the time.   He hasn’t read it amd he doesn’t understand it, but his perception of it is any way there’s a loophole he doesn’t have to adhere to what was previously understood and do something else and rationalize it as an interpretation somehow. He knows he has to uphold the constitution, and he also wants to do many things against it, so he’s trying to reconcile these under any technicality he can scrounge up so he can claim he kept his oath.
